Reviews.Title: “Noisy”
Reviews.Author: Laureninvail17
Reviews.Content: You can hear right through the walls and if your room is in the building near US1 then you can hear cars going by throughout the night. Disappointing.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay!”
Reviews.Author: maddawg78
Reviews.Content: Just stayed here for two nights. We got a room with a view of the bay at the back of the hotel. It was very quiet. The room was very clean. I enjoyed getting breakfast at the Starbucks then sitting on the boardwalk in the mornings. Very nice and relaxing pool. Rent bicycles next door to get around town. Wish we could have stayed longer!!!

Reviews.Title: “Find another”
Reviews.Author: Tori R
Reviews.Content: Room was decent, but TV was broken and impossible to contact front desk. Horrible service. Would never go back. We ended up leaving midway through our stay and it was the best decision. If you're trying to find a nice resort check out Parrot Key Resort. It is right down the road and beautiful condos and pools.

Reviews.Title: “Life is too short to stay in a hotel like this”
Reviews.Author: asteph_12
Reviews.Content: The employees were horridly rude and did not care about any one in our group. The shuttle driver was never there--extremely undependable. We usually ended up paying for a taxi even though the hotel proudly advertises a free shuttle. The hotel room was dirty and the pool area was not nice at all. Our group left after one night and rented another hotel nearby which was ten times nicer, which respectful employees, for a cheaper price. Do not ruin your key west experience by staying at this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Staff puts this place over the top. Nice and friendly and helpful”
Reviews.Author: Drandrl
Reviews.Content: Problems we had was room Location. We were right in the front because of limited handicap access. A lot of road traffic. But several guests that were in the back had no problem. It was a great property around the water. No restaurant on property. It was in season so be prepared to pay a lot

Reviews.Title: “It's Key West, all the rooms are expensive.”
Reviews.Author: Davega1
Reviews.Content: Older property, I dare say it was probably some other brand of motor lodge. Marriott clean, but it is outside entrance to all the rooms and the walls are thin. Waterfront means on a canal, which is clean, but not swimmable but there is a tanning beach. Tiki bar is cool and staff is great. Is it worth $300 a night? I have a hard time saying yes.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel and staff.”
Reviews.Author: John S
Reviews.Content: Great hotel and staff, I stay at this hotel everytime I do business in Key West. Me and my coworkers use this hotel all the time,the staff always makes our stay feel like home. There is almost nothing that they will not do for you. They have a courtesy van to bring you downtown so you do not have to worry about driving. It is always clean and safe. When you go tell them that the guys from the Teamsters union sent you......

Reviews.Title: “Was hoping for more...”
Reviews.Author: LizLosAngeles
Reviews.Content: We took a red-eye flight to MIami, then drove 3-4 hours to Key West. We were pretty exhausted and had hoped to check into the room a little earlier. We got there at 1pm, the clerk said our room wasn't ready. I gave her my cell phone number to call me. I didn't get the call. We hung out at the tiki bar for a couple of hours. When 3pm rolled around, I went to the front desk. The female didn't take responsibility for not calling me when my room was ready. I am a Silver Marriott Rewards member, so I had hoped to get free breakfast as other reviewers had mentioned. I inquired at the front desk but they said no. The location is okay. There is a shopping center across the street in case you need to shop for goods. The shuttle was helpful and we took advantage of it to get into town. We only stayed one night and this hotel served the purpose.

Reviews.Title: “Best service - friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: Hans S
Reviews.Content: Arrived with a group of friends and had the best stay we ever dreamed of - very nice tropic pool area - own beachfront - free shuttle to downtown and very friendly staff. Nice rooms with pool or beach view - fridge - coffee. Only a minor problem with my breakfastorder - asked for a ham/cheese omelet and the waiter asked "What do you want in your omelet ??"

Reviews.Title: “Way over priced... $399 a night”
Reviews.Author: pookanu
Reviews.Content: Bed was comfy - liked the pillows. Lots of them and they were cozy. Pool, staff, jacquzzi, palm trees were nice. Traffic from busy street was too loud and unpleasant to look at.

Reviews.Title: “Room not ready until several hours after check in time”
Reviews.Author: Will T
Reviews.Content: We arrived to check in to our room on 1/2/11 at the specified check in time and were informed that our room was not ready but it should be soon and we would receive a call when it was ready. There were several other disgruntled people in the lobby waiting so we dropped our luggage off at the front desk and went out to see the city. We requested that our luggage be placed in our room when the room was ready, the sort of thing that you would expect at a $300/night hotel (they assured us that the luggage would be in the room). Two hours after we attempted to check in the hotel we had still not received a phone call regarding our room so we called and discovered that our room had just been cleaned. When we arrived back at the hotel four hours after check in, our room was ready but the luggage was still at the front desk. We had to load all of the luggage back in the car ourselves and drive around to the room. We did not receive any help with the luggage nor did we receive any apology or explanation. THIS IS A TWO STAR HOTEL AT BEST! Worth $100/night max!

Reviews.Title: “Needs work”
Reviews.Author: Dubrule
Reviews.Content: this marriott is older and tired needs updating . The goods news they have Sharon at the front desk who treats the place like she owns it .Very helpful . Breakfast included which was good. Not near downtown and the shuttle only goes to one dropoff and pickup location, so not as convenient as it sounds. Our room was wheelchair accesible but we did have some ants, but it was florida.

Reviews.Title: “Great Visit & Hospitality”
Reviews.Author: grannypuc
Reviews.Content: Very nice place to stay, clean, all staff so caring and willing to assist with any concerns. Complimentary shuttle to and from Mallory Square location and you could visit Duval street, and downtown. We thoroughly enjoyed everything and hope to return in 2012. I made a purchase downtown and left it in the shuttle, checked with front office and product was there. Good honest drivers!

Reviews.Title: “Sharon saved us!”
Reviews.Author: Deborah S
Reviews.Content: We were thoroughly disgusted with Fairfield down the street -- called Marriott Courtyard and Sharon answered. Gave us outstanding service, checked in early, complimentary breakfast, had room #128 which was newly renovated with inside acess. Complimentary shuttle to downtown. We are foodies and ate at Michael's (Sharon suggestion) and Louie's -- excellent, excellent, excellent!! Sharon and Marriott Courtyard saved out getaway from disaster. I travel for living and Marriott is my choice!

Reviews.Title: “Spacious rooms”
Reviews.Author: sunyatcamp
Reviews.Content: We only stayed here one night but would stay here again. Alot of bang for your buck. There was a spa tub in the room and a kitchenette.....a living room and seperate bedroom. The campus was beautiful...on the water. I wish I had satyed here the whole time I was in Key West

Reviews.Title: “Hotel is was Average.... the walls are paper thin!”
Reviews.Author: 1travelgypsy
Reviews.Content: My Fiance and I had to make the trip to Key West to meet with vendors for our upcoming wedding. My fiance came across the courtyard and it was rather inexpensive in comparison to the other hotels in the area so we went with it. After getting up at 4am to catch our flight to Miami and then driving for 4 hours to Key West we were absolutely exhausted and were in serious need of some sleep. That's when we learned how loud the hotel was. The walls are quite literally paper thin. Kids running up and down the hallway laughing & screaming sounded like a herd of elephants. Guests staying next door to us having a causal conversation sounded as if they were in the room with us. At one point I heard a male's voice ask a question - I assumed it was my Fiance and answered him... turned out to be the guy next door! The bathroom was very small and counter space was something to be desired. An individual on the heavier side may think the bathroom is uncomfortably small. The shower head is set very low so anyone over 5'6 has to bend back in order to wet their hair. My Fiance, with back issues, had an interesting time showering during our stay. The Internet took quite a while to get working. My Fiance is in IT so he eventually figured it out - the average Joe probably would not have gotten the internet to work. The breakfast bar was nice. They serve Starbucks! You get to choose once meal from their menu and it's complementary with your meal ticket they give you at check-in. The food lacks flavor, but with all the fabulous restaurants around with extensive menus we found ourselves eating breakfast at the hotel only once. The pool was really nice & they have a tiki bar for those wanting to drink while sunbathing. The hotel also has a small "beach" which seems great for little kids - doesn't get deep. Staff here was fabulous - super friendly! The hotel shuttle runs every 30 minutes to Duval Street and we took full advantage of this amenity during our stay. The shuttle stops picking guests up on Duval Street at 10:30 which was a little early for us bar hoppers, so we ended up with a Taxi. Taxis from the hotel - to Mallory Square/ Duval Street will cost you $20.00. Not bad, but it adds up fast. For those contemplating whether or not to use a rental car throughout the stay I highly advise against it. Parking down by Duval Street is very rare and very expensive! Rental bikes, mopeds and rental golf-carts are the way to go for those unable to walk very far. One more thing - they have a Pizza Hut literally right across the street that closes at 1am. Being able to get pizza hut after a day of drinking was fabulous!

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: tray0106
Reviews.Content: The rooms are very pleasant and comfortable. The location is awesome and easy to find. The breakfast is nothing to brag about as there is not a very good selection. We ended up going down the road to Denny's. The beds are typical Marriott beds and are very comfortable. There is a very good restaurant across the road. I would recommend this hotel to anyone going to Key West.

Reviews.Title: “Recent Stay at Courtyard”
Reviews.Author: jackel55
Reviews.Content: Key West â€“ August 14 -22, 2011 9 days We visited Key West from August 14 to August 28, 2011. We expected the town to be all party and not adaptive to a family style vacation but found otherwise much to our satisfaction. Duval Street is certainly a party capital but there is plenty for families to do. We stayed at the Marriott Courtyard Waterfront. Donâ€™t let the waterfront fool you. Yes it is on the waterfront (bay side of the Keys) but there is not much to do at this â€œwaterfront.â€� It is mostly mangrove and turtle grass which, while essential to the ecosystem, is not good for sunbathing and swimming. Of course this is typical in the Keys. The benefits of staying at this location are that it is handy to the shopping centers across the street with a K Mart, Albertsons Groceries and many restaurants. There is an hourly shuttle to Old Town. You could walk to old town but it is quite a hike. It is quieter at this end of the island in comparison to staying in Old Town. The hotel is not up to the usual Courtyard standards (we stay at Courtyards frequently) and from what I understand is a conversion from another brand. The pool is adequate. The room was serviceable. We were on the ground floor of a two story hotel so had easy access to the pool through the sliding door. We asked for a refrigerator early in the week and were promised one as soon as one became available but it never showed up. We were going to stay at the Key West Marriott but they only had king beds and that would not have worked for our party of three. An alternative to the Courtyard may be the Fairfield Inn a couple of blocks away. I viewed the hotel from the outside and it looked good. You usually get a free breakfast at Fairfields. There is no shuttle to Old Town. We would consider staying here again. It is not a resort experience (not too many places are in Key West) but still provided sufficient comforts for our five days on the island. Key West is a charming town. Be sure to visit Mallory Square at sundown for all types of eclectic entertainment. You have to have you photo taken at the Southernmost Point in the U.S. if only to say that you been there and done that. It is a short walk from southern end of Duval Street. I had an interesting tour of Ernest Hemmingwayâ€™s House. We beached at Fort Zachary State Park. There is an admission fee and some interesting snorkeling off shore. Be sure to bring water shoes since it is a rocky beach. The highlight was a manatee that surprised us in about eight feet of water. It caused quite a commotion on shore much to the consternation of my wife. I highly recommend the Yankee Freedom ferry trip to the Dry Tortugas National Park. The crew was great. The Dry Tortugas are truly a gem at sea and the snorkeling exceptional. The trip is expensive at $160 a person, but a must see experience. We use Jan and Michaelâ€™s Stern book, 500 Things to Eat Before Itâ€™s Too Late as our gastro-entertainment guide when traveling. It has not guided us to indigestion yet. So we ate at Louieâ€™s Backyard. The location is postcard perfect on the ocean side of the Key. The food is expensive ($150 for three, food only) but exceptional. Donâ€™t miss Blue Heaven Pancakes for breakfast, lunch or dinner. The pancakes are heavenly. And donâ€™t be afraid to ask for Key Lime Pie for breakfast dessert. The meringue crowns out at 4 inches and is like eating clouds. Prices are reasonable (between $40 - $60 for three). Donâ€™t let the roosters distract you. We ended up there three times and the taste buds never tired. A&B Lobster House was excellent. It is expensive but the service is impeccable and food well worth the price. The Half Shell Raw Bar was great. Too bad they canâ€™t keep the pigeons out of the eating area. Kermitâ€™s Key West Key Lime Shoppe was nifty. The frozen Key Lime Pie on a stick was a tourist magnet but quite tasty. Parking is very limited in Old Town. Duval Street is an impossible drive in the evening. There is a public garage on the corner of Grinnell and Caroline. We parked there for the all day ferry trip. It is four blocks from Duval Street.

Reviews.Title: “Lush tropical landscape, georgous property!”
Reviews.Author: jonk73
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for a weekend getaway and were really surprised to find a truly beautiful landscape, on the inlet water, great staff and clean rooms.

Reviews.Title: “Will definitely stay here again”
Reviews.Author: chiquicyp
Reviews.Content: We did not have reservations since it was a was a last minute getaway but were pleasently surprised for this hotel to have an available room on Labor Day weekend. It was very clean and close to a supermarket and liquor store. Loved the rooster and iguanas running around. We did have a room off the main street but could not here the traffic but looking at the courtyard on the other side of the room. The lobby was very nice and had a Starbucks Shop. Overall, a very nice hotel for the price and staff was friendly. Will recommend to family and friends but not to smokers.

Reviews.Title: “Not as nice as other Courtyards by Marriott, but good deal in Key West”
Reviews.Author: ImisstheGipper
Reviews.Content: The rooms are in need of updating. The carpet is old, the a/c units smell a bit moldy, and the hallways are a bit musty. While there is no smoking in the rooms, this location had the loosest smoking policy of any Marriott I have stayed at. For instance, smoking is allowed at the Tiki bar by the pool, so the smells waft over to where families are sitting poolside. Also, lots of smoking on the boardwalk and back deck. I have stayed at many Courtyards in several cities and I am used to them being considerably nicer. The beds in this particular location are memory foam mattresses. I don't prefer that type, but some people do. With that said, the hotel was a good deal and I would consider staying there again if I were in Key West. We had 5 in our party, so we stayed in a two room suite with 2 queens in the bedroom and and a sleeper bed in the living room. The room also had a jacuzzi tub, refrigerator, microwave, and a safe. There is a coffee bar that serves Starbucks and a concierge in the lobby that is real helpful planning activities. It is not close to Duvall St., but they have a free shuttle that takes you near to all the action and leaves every 30 min. The shuttle is a nice amenity as parking in old town is a hassle. The hotel is real close to a Kmart, Albertsons, and Publix which came in handy.

Reviews.Title: “Average hotel - not bad but not great”
Reviews.Author: liliam
Reviews.Content: Just stayed at this hotel on Key West. The lobby is great...just renovated. The staff was friendly and accommodating. The rooms are in need of updating. The carpet was kind of dirty...not terrible though. The pool is average but does have a tiki bar and hot tub. They also offer a free shuttle to downtown kw. Overall, the stay was non-eventful. I can't say anything great about the hotel but I don't have anything awful to report either...it was just average.

Reviews.Title: “Shuttle Bus made this convenient”
Reviews.Author: tfuselier
Reviews.Content: Overall I thought the hotel was really overpriced. The front desk during the day was helpful and friendly, but the evening shift was not. However, since this was our first trip to Key West we weren't sure what area to stay in so the shuttle bus to downtown was perfect. Shuttle bus driver was friendly and helpful too. The hotel stay was ok, the shuttle bus is the only thing that really made the stay here worthwhile. If we return Key West we'll choose another hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Good but no frills and far from the fun”
Reviews.Author: blckhze
Reviews.Content: We booked a room for my husband and I and a second room for our elderly grandparents. We thought a trip not too far from them would be a great idea. This hotel honors AAA discounts but it's a bad location with no beach. It's on a busy, noisy main room so request a second floor room in the back. The set up reminded me of a motel and there's no area for a full breakfast. They have a Starbucks that offers several small breakfast foods. The front desk was kind and very helpful-we found out when we got there though that there are next to know accommodations for the elderly or handicapped. There are no elevators. The rooms and pool were clean. The bar by the pool Only serves lunch for a few hours but makes great, affordable meals. There is a free shuttle that takes you into the main area of Key West and the hotel has free WiFi and parking. We found the concierge to be so not helpful and only recommended particular brands. He almost steered us toward a dinner cruise that wasn't handicapped accessible but thankfully another staff member gave us the real deal. There's no gift shop but a small closet like area with a few snacks and travel items. This hotel is good if you want a name you can trust, descent service, and don't care about having a view (no room does really). It's small so there's not too much chance of a big crowd and noise there.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful hotel would stay again”
Reviews.Author: NifT33
Reviews.Content: There are two Marriott properties maybe 2 miles apart. This Marriott is closer to the downtown area than the other property which comes up as you first enter Key West. The rooms were big, clean and the beds were very comfy! The pool was great and the staff was welcoming and helpful. They offer a free shuttle to the Duval Street area which was great...no need to find parking. They also had some great recommendations for meals. I researched many hotels on Key West and all were expensive. This Marriott was not any more expensive that most other lodging I looked into. Granted it was not as updated and fancy as the other Marriott property...we did not spend much time in the room so it was fine. It was clean and spacious and convenient. Breakfast was not offered with the room. Although I am not desperate for a morning coffee, I do like to have one and I asked about this. We were informed that the coffee shop (located in the front desk area) is available and the front desk can make coffee for us if no one was at the counter and we wanted one. Wonderful service! I appreciated that! The hotel is also directly across from a shopping area so if we needed a grocery store it was very convenient. It is on the main thoroughfare but not noisy even with the shopping right there. I might recommend asking for a room towards the back of the hotel. It is closer to the water and very quiet. There is a very small "boardwalk" with some chairs and a few tables if you want to sit and look out of over the water. We watched some horseshoe crabs, some fish, some lizards (geckos maybe?) and an iguana. The craziness of Duval Street is close enough but the chaos of it is not. This mid-range hotel is a worthy choice.

Reviews.Title: “BED BUGS---WOW!!!! But a great hotel otherwise!!!”
Reviews.Author: DrBeverly
Reviews.Content: My family was here just for one night staying on our Rewards Points...clean, nice..but not fancy room...which we expected from looking at the website. Front desk check-in was friendly and without hassle. We were able to check-in early as a room was available when we arrived (11:30) which was convenient and pleasantly surprising. Pool was small but ok....waterfront lagoon had nurse sharks, stingrays, and horseshoe crabs which my 11 and 13 year old children found fascinating. Until the next morning....driving away in the car my children both started complaining about strange bites up and down their bodies....thank goodness we have strong minded kids...because they were pretty level-headed about finding out that they had bed bug bites (although my 13 yr old girl will never stay at another Marriott in Key West). Yes...the bites were confirmed to be bed bugs (linear bites). More hellacious than mosquito bites by far! They became pustular and infected that same day. Of course the hotel denies this....we only stayed one night at a hotel (Courtyard Marriott Key West) and we didn't stay anywhere else that my children would have gotten these bed bug bites. My kids have never been exposed to this before and I hope that they never will again. Please be aware of this problem at this hotel if you dare stay here!!!

Reviews.Title: “Nice place”
Reviews.Author: YBaumgartner
Reviews.Content: Nice hotel with good service. They have a really nice pool which I think is cooled and provide freshness during the warm June. We took a nice suite with Jacuzzi. The suite had two rooms with a balcony on the pool. Nice and clean room with coffee machine, microwave and free internet. Free parking and also free regular shuttle to go near Duval street until 10.45 pm Good service and nice employees. No in-room food service. Really good food at the Tiki Bar at the pool but closes quite early in the evening. The only really annoying point was the Air Conditioner. They have in room AC appliance. This means the appliance is getting every 10 minutes on and off and makes a lot of noise. I don't understand why they didn't install external systems.

Reviews.Title: “A Wonderful Discovery!”
Reviews.Author: Kim054
Reviews.Content: As part of my nephew's graduation gift, my family and I traveled down the Florida Keys. We booked a two room suite at the Courtyard Marriott. We had a room overlooking the courtyard which is beautifully landscaped. The pool is large and heated. There were plenty of lounge chairs surrounding the pool area. The courtyard is complete with a jacuzzi and a poolside bar. They have free shuttles to the Mallory Square in downtown Key West which we used all the time while we were there. As I stated, it was a two room suite complete with a mini-fridge, microwave, coffee pot and safe. Each room had it's own bath and well stocked with towels. We searched the internet for the best deals for a family of six and this Marriott was a wonderful discovery.

Reviews.Title: “Worth the money!!”
Reviews.Author: RFDisturbance
Reviews.Content: What a vacation!! I looked at several hotels online before traveling, and noticed that all were a little pricey, but considering it is Key West, we thought it was to be expected. We were going to stay elsewhere, but I figured for a little more money, let's stay somewhere worth it. This was the right choice!! What an amazing room! We got the king suite with whirlpool and balcony. The staff was extremely friendly and the hotel was very modern and clean. We were even allowed to stay parked on the property after check-out and were allowed to use the shuttle to head back downtown one last time before heading back to Miami!! This is not a hotel to lounge at the beach (Key West is not known for its beaches), and prices are inherently higher in Key west regardless. The plus to not being right downtown is the quiet night you will have getting a great night's sleep. besides you have the free shuttle to get you downtown which means no paying for parking and no worries driving and trying to find your way. Whirlpool was great, room was fantastic, and this will be a hotel I would recommend and return to if I am ever back in Key West! Great Job Courtyard!!

Reviews.Title: “Very Pleasant Stay”
Reviews.Author: johnf2769
Reviews.Content: Very nice accomodations. As one can expect from a Marriott property, this was a clean, comfortable hotel. Front Desk personnel were friendly and helpful. Location was good and landscaping was appealing. Those in our party who used the Tiki Bar were greeted by friendly and courteous personnel. We will be back!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent accommodation in key west, very relaxing - we loved it!”
Reviews.Author: ELC66
Reviews.Content: This was a really lovely hotel which was clean and comfortable. We liked it so much we stayed an extra night. There was free internet access and a really nice swimming pool which was excellent for relaxing. It was a littled bit away from the main area of shops/bars/restaurants but a courtesy bus was provided to take you and bring you back. There was free parking and some restaurants and other facilities nearby but the hotel had its own facilities for food.

Reviews.Title: “Next time I'll stay at Fairfield down the street and save a few bucks.”
Reviews.Author: CactusGary
Reviews.Content: I wanted to stay at a Marriott property for the reward points. I chose this hotel over the Fairfield down the street because of the waterfront feature. Well that's not much to get excited about. The wooden board walk is nice but there's not much of a view. There's a small beach but I wouldn't want to get in the water. Otherwise my room was very large. The pool and tiki bar looked good but I didn't use them. They make breakfast in a very nice lobby but they got my order wrong and the scrambled eggs were over cooked. There's a Starbucks in the lobby which was an unexpected surprise. One staff member was very helpful with local questions but the next day three staffers didn't have a clue. A hotel shuttle leaves frequently for downtown and it's a quick ride. I also drove downtown a couple times and didn't have a problem finding a parking spot on the street. The hotel website and television channel guide said HBO was provided but the channel was static. When I asked the night clerk about this, they didn't have a clue and offered no solution. Because I had a car, free, ample parking at the hotel was also a plus.

Reviews.Title: “It was just okay.”
Reviews.Author: Travelholic-Cheryl
Reviews.Content: The waterfront view was not so hot. The cleanliness was good. The staff was very nice and helpful. I feel this hotel is extremely over priced. It is a distance from all the action close to Duval St., but luckily they had a shuttle service that took you to the action near Duval St. I wish they had a shuttle service to and from the airport instead of having to pay for a taxi cab. If I return to Key West, Florida I will not stay at this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Mixed”
Reviews.Author: gofree
Reviews.Content: The staff is OK but nothing extra. The physical facility is so so. This hotel was not built as a Courtyard and the rooms are in dire need of a through refurbishing. Our room had a definite worn over look with an obscure ongoing smell. An old TV which should have departed a couple of years ago. There is so much you can do to a bathroom that hasn't seen a thorough redo in years. This Courtyard did a thorough remodel of the common area and it is very nice. No more cafe but a Starbucks with expanded food options. The pool area is nice and large and is kept clean. The front desk staff could use a tune up on guest relations 101. The courtesy shuttle to downtown is probably the stand out feature of this hotel and it is nice with regular service from early to late time options.

Reviews.Title: “Love it here.”
Reviews.Author: Flgatorsrthebest
Reviews.Content: Friendly staff with a great shuttle to get to duval street. Excellent tiki bar with a great lunch menu for relaxing at the pool in the afternoon. Will be staying here again.

Reviews.Title: “Away from the crowds, with a free shuttle to take you to Old Town!”
Reviews.Author: cincykat
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 3 nights. There were 5 of us traveling together, and we had a 2 bedroom "penthouse suite" as the hotel called it. One bedroom had a King bed, the other had 2 queens, and there was a living room with a pull-out sofa bed. There were 2 bathrooms and a small kitchen area with a mini-fridge and a microwave. The hotel was located away from the bustle of Old Town, but there was a free shuttle that left the hotel on the hour and half hour from 8 AM until 10:30 PM. The shuttle went to the marina, which puts you within easy walking distance of Duval Street, many restaurants, and attractions. The word Waterfront in the title is a little misleading. There is a very small beach and a nice deck area, but there are no sweeping scenic views or even adequate space to swim. The pool is nice, as is the Tiki Bar. The staff was very friendly.

Reviews.Title: “Old rundown Howard Johnson's that was never updated. At least the rooms weren't.”
Reviews.Author: Onesix16
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for one night and we actually called our old hotel in the middle Keys and begged them to take us back but they were too full. The hotel staff was very friendly and the lobby and breakfast area were very clean and updated. However, it's an old HoJos and the rooms were disgusting. We had worms on the rug and tiles that were falling off the wall. This place was a motel that made you feel like you were stuck in the 70's. I would not recommend this place at all, even if you are just there to sleep like we were. I have stayed at five star resorts and I have stayed at places like Comfort Inn and AmeriSuites and they are ce as long as they are clean but this place was gross.

Reviews.Title: “not good on the inside and well over priced”
Reviews.Author: pacsgirl
Reviews.Content: We were suppose to get the "queen suite" well we did big thumbs down paid 380 for a dumpy old room. Yes the room was big but the carpet was ripped, furniture was old the couch I wouldn't even sit anyone on. Both bathrooms didnt have a vent/ fan there was mold on the ceiling of the one bathroom. The tubs were very worn the soap dishes were not clean. I told the person at the front desk they didn't seem to care and I did call the manager the next day she didn't seem to care too much either almost was defensive. We were suppose to stay another night but went across the street to the Fairfield updated rooms, clean beautiful pool and grounds free breakfast friendly staff.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place”
Reviews.Author: KathieS1
Reviews.Content: Three friends and I stayed Sunday-Thursday in a 1 bedroom suite. There is a grocery store and dollar store across the street. We were able to have breakfast in our room although it could be purchased in their cafe. The shuttle to downtown was wonderful; very convienent, not too crowded and the driver was very helpful. We stayed in building C which did not have an elevator and it was difficult getting our luggage up to the second floor. But when we told the front desk they said they would provide help with our luggage and they did as we left. We did not use our car at all while we were there. The pool and hot tub were very relaxing. The carpet in the living room was a bit worn but the beds were comfortable. The sofa bed was not great for an adult. This is a quiet place, not a "party" place, which was good for us. The beach was good for sunny and looking at the horseshoe crabs but not for swimming.

Reviews.Title: “Very pricey.”
Reviews.Author: calif0rnia
Reviews.Content: The hotel room was clean. There were no bedbugs. There was a nice balcony attached to our room but unfortunately, it was too cool outside for us to be able to make use of it. The staff at check in was very pleasant. There was a free shuttle that left and arrived very frequently to drive guests to downtown Key West. Taking the shuttle was much more convenient than having to worry about parking which is at a premium. My only complaint was the price, but, I guess that it was the area that we were paying for. The hotel room was filled with small characters that had been created out of towels. I found this to be a bit tacky and probably a huge waste of someone's time.

Reviews.Title: “It's a friendly, relaxing hotel with great setting and amenities.”
Reviews.Author: fell0wtraveler48
Reviews.Content: The public space is warm and inviting. It's comfortable and offers lots of options for privacy. The Bistro serves a very nice selection of breakfast and lunch items, prepared well. Rooms are very clean (my biggest concern always), quiet and comfortable. Balconies are small but private. The verandas and deck areas offer further possibilities for private lunch or reading/relaxing and even birdwatching on the waterfront. Pool and whirlpool areas are large and surrounded by lovely vegetation, creating yet another quiet, secluded spot. All of the wait staff, with one exception, and other personnel were especially friendly and helpful, very low-key, adding to the relaxing atmosphere. The Bistro and front desk personnel were especially wonderful. The exercise room could be larger.

Reviews.Title: “Best hotel I've stayed at in Key West, nothing bad to say about it”
Reviews.Author: KevDough
Reviews.Content: I've travelled to Key West over ten times in the last decade due to the fact that my brother lives there, and this is by far the best hotel I've stayed at. After checking out of a budget hotel that I booked on Hotwire due to the quality or lack thereof of that place, the Courtyard really saved my trip. I paid a good amount for my room, close to $200 if I remember correctly, but I would not complain for a second about anything as that is a reasonable rate for a hotel of this class in Key West. The location is good, being a short distance away from Duval Street, though not close enough to walk, but that is the norm for Key West unless you are staying in a 4 star place in Old Town. It is on the water, but don't really think "beach resort" as it's more of just a sun bathing area. The pool, however, was excellent as well as the hot tub which is big and has a canopy around it. My room was gorgeous, overlooking the pool which I think all the rooms were as I believe that's what a Marriott "Courtyard" seeks to achieve as the hotels all seem to be configured the same way so that the pool area acts as the heart of the premises. The bed was so wonderful, the bathroom great, and the hotel and room itself were completely immaculate. I would recommend this place to anyone and I assure you that you will not be disappointed with choosing this place.

Reviews.Title: “Great Suite Accomodations for group of 5”
Reviews.Author: babsrose
Reviews.Content: On Christmas Day, we checked into the Courtyard Marriott. We were a group of five. Our Mother, our two sisters, my husband and myself. We were pleasantly surprised by the size of the suite we reserved. The rooms were very large and could easily accomodate a group of 8 or 10 if children. The bedrooms consisted of one king room, a room with two queens and a sofa sleeper, as well as a sofa sleeper in the living room. We had a balcony with view of the water and the convenience of a refrigerator and microwave. The hotel staff was very accomodating and a shuttle runs every half hour to the downtown waterfront area. There is also a Starbucks in the hotel which was an added plus. It was too cold for us to use the pool, but they also have a heated spa. They have a Tiki Hut Bar outside that serves drinks. I recommend this location even though it's not in the heart of town. Restaurants and shopping is also located across the street.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome Stay”
Reviews.Author: Ilangilang
Reviews.Content: We went for a day trip to Keywest, FL and decided to stay overnight. We walked in at the Courtyard to see if they have any room available. They did so we stayed for the night. At the check in they immediately gave us the information for the approximate time of the sunset and the best place to view it. They also have a shuttle that goes to the downtown area which is where the best viewing area. The shuttle saved us money and time and teh drivers were all very accomodating. Wonderful place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “First Trip to Key West and the hotel was perfect for us”
Reviews.Author: 1tiredpuppy
Reviews.Content: My family of four spent two nights at Thanksgiving. I paid for the trip with Marriott points, so I can't speak to extra charges, etc. The staff, from the front desk to the shuttle driver, were all very nice. The hotel offers free shuttle service down to the waterfront and this was a huge plus for us. When one person got tired, we put them on the shuttle and knew they would safely get back to the hotel. Our room was a standard room with two queen beds. We had a small patio that led to the pool, which we loved. The pool area was very nice with a large pool. There is a small beach, but I wouldn't suggest getting in the water. The grounds are very lush and well kept. There is a boardwalk that wonders out to the water that has chairs so that you can sit and relax. The hotel lobby had just been renovated and was absolutely gorgeous. There were computers for guests to use and free coffee and teas available. The only negative comment that I have is that we had to keep going to the front desk to get enough towels. Housekeeping only wanted to give us towels for 3 people and there were clearly 4 on the reservation. Other then that, we liked this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great Accommodation for 6 People”
Reviews.Author: sanibeltravler
Reviews.Content: We were able to book a suite for 6 persons--3 separate rooms/2 bathrooms (king, two queens, and a sofa sleeper). This also had a balcony and a little kitchenette. We were kindly greeted when we arrived and they took our luggage, tagged it, and it was waiting in our room when we returned at check-in time. The shuttle to downtown runs at convenient times and it was easy to get around from the shuttle drop-off in fron the the Conch Republic Seafood House. The pool bar was staffed by a very friendly and informative couple (husband/wife team). When we returned in the evening, we had a power outage (all over KW) and the night manager was very kind, brought us utensils to eat our key lime pie in the lobby. Breakfast was ample continental style. When we left at noon, they tagged our bags again and delivered them to the ferry terminal at 4:15 PM. Great staff.

Reviews.Title: “Fire Ants.”
Reviews.Author: 1mariposa
Reviews.Content: First night was ok but far from Marriott standards. Second night was horrific! TV made strange noises cracking, popping like it was going to blow up a few hours later it sounded like someone was playing drums next door of course we are right by the exercise room my husband goes outside to see what's going on and finds hotel employee watching tv. Haha that's funny... He's watching tv and mine doesn't work properly. I get up to go to the bathroom and there is fire ants all over the floor and in the shower.... Thank God I always wear shoes in hotel rooms. I call the front desk and he says " I can move you upstairs" it's pouring down rain and no elevator. What was he thinking? He gave us breakfast coupons whoop de doo! The breakfast was substandard and the construction noise was awful couldn't even eat it was so noisy..... My compensation for all that was 50% off my room rate. Well thanks allot Marriott!!!!! One more thing the beach behind the hotel is not really a beach it looks like sewage water.

Reviews.Title: “Hidden Charge”
Reviews.Author: ocujes
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this hotel from 8/5/10 to 8/8/10/. In general this is a nice and quite hotel to go with your family. The rooms, at least our, are very spacious and clean. The beach you see in the picture is useless. Now keep track of your credit card, I supposed to be charge $671 for my stay and I was charged almost $1000.00. Dont trust in the number they gave you at check out, go home and check your account online and hope you dont have the surprise I got!!!. They said they will return my money back but when? nobady knows. Good Luck!!

Reviews.Title: “Not a Vacation Hotel”
Reviews.Author: MikeInSugarland
Reviews.Content: Our family just came back from a 4 nts stay at this hotel from 6/14 - 6/18. Now, I know why there is only a few pics of the hotel. It's just isn't worth taking any. Like others have said, this hotel is dated - furnitures are old looking, the beds are lumpy and roll like a waterbed, the hallway carpets look worn out and have wet stains all over the place. Top it off, the toilet doesn't flush too well - we have to use the lobby restroom because we didn't want to deal with it. Worst of all, our bathroom feel like a cheap motel - bath tub looks dirty, shower grouts have moldy stains and peeling. My youngest son took one look immediately asked me "Can we go back to the Hampton Inn " (and Suites in Key Largo) ? The only saving graces for this hotel are some of the friendly staffs working there. The late night reception folks are always helpful in giving us directions to different places. Both of the shuttle drivers who took us to Mallory Square are always courteous, polite, and on time. I travel for a living and this is definitely not up to Marriott standard. Bottom line: I would not come back again and definitely do not recommend this hotel to any. Save your money and look else where ..

Reviews.Title: “un happy”
Reviews.Author: sheba12392
Reviews.Content: we stayed there may 28 and 29 room was lagoon front staff alright .. we wanted to check out after the first night but they would not credit us THE 239 for the second night and she did not even have the nerve to come out of the office to talk to me ..THAT WAS VERY RUDE . no fridge no continental breakfast for that amount of money we will never stay in any marriott again ..

Reviews.Title: “Run as Fast as You can.”
Reviews.Author: HappyTraveling22
Reviews.Content: I stayed here with some friends last summer and It was horrible. The staff was unfriendly,the rooms were in unsatisfactory condition,outdated furniture,the beds were uncomfortable,the scenery was just ok and the location is horrible. I will never visit again.

Reviews.Title: “Wow Wow Wow”
Reviews.Author: AnshumanGoyal
Reviews.Content: This was the best of all hotels I stayed in Florida during my recent trip. It is really good and moreover in center of down town. Highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Love this hotel, our second stay and I would like to come here again”
Reviews.Author: LondonerOutAndAbout
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 2 nights last year and liked it so much we decided to come back for longer this year. So 5 nights this time and we loved every one of them. The staff are great both in the reception and the pool bar, and housekeeping standards are excellent too. The complimentary bus that takes you into town is a great bonus and means you can escape the mania (it was spring break!) to a relatively quiet spot. Yes it is out of town but that suited us, there is enough close by to get something to eat if you want a quiet night or you take the complimentary mini bus to town for the bars and restaurants of the Duval Street area.

Reviews.Title: “Ok but not great”
Reviews.Author: Carbern
Reviews.Content: Unexpectedly, we extended our stay in Key West for one more day. Unfortunately the Marriott Beachside Hotel was sold out and we needed to move to this hotel. We checked in early and the front-desk staff was very friendly and accommodating. She check us in quickly and followed up with a phone call to make sure the we are happy with the room. The room is somewhat outdated and the bathroom setting is awkward. There is a sink inside and outside the bathroom. The shower tub seemed to be unevenly re-lined with acrylic. When I stepped into the shower tab, I felt like I was walking on bubbles. While other reviewers commented the bed was uncomfortable, it was surprising our bed was comfortable and it seem to be the best part of the hotel room. Overall, it is a OK hotel in Key West for a short stay. The staff and services definitely made it a better hotel, but I will stay at the Marriott Beachside if possible considered the price difference is not that much.

Reviews.Title: “Our stay here was a great experience”
Reviews.Author: albanykat1
Reviews.Content: My husband and I just got home from a three night stay here and we loved it. The location is terrific; the service even better. The free shuttle to downtown (2 miles) was so handy and our morning driver was great. An example of the perfect service was the evening we were going into town for sunset (a must) and the shuttle filled up just as we were to board. Out the front door comes another employee and he offers to take us to town right away...this was over and above our expectations. We loved the pool, the Tiki Bar and our suite was just what we had hoped for. Even during Spring Break time, it was quiet . I highly reccommend this hotel for a great stay

Reviews.Title: “Amazing value, Immaculate Place”
Reviews.Author: JimiF
Reviews.Content: We booked online and arrived at the port with the Key West Express from Ft. Meyers in the rain. I called the hotel and since it was 15 miutes before the hotel shuttle would arrive, they called us a cab which arrived in 30 seconds. All of the "rain pain" disappeared when they got us into a great room 3 hours before standard check in time and we were able to enjoy our "Cheesburger in Paradise" at the covered Tiki bar by the pool. Carla, the bartender is a true pro. The hotel shuttle was always avaialble for the short ride to and from Duval and Front St. The grounds were always being cleaned and the staff was top notch from top to bottom.

Reviews.Title: “dont stay here”
Reviews.Author: friendScottTwp
Reviews.Content: We were very unhappy could not sleep at night we had room facing highway the noise was unbearable but manage told me that no one else ever complained. I'm sorry but the room was not sound proof at all you can look outside the cracks of door when standing in room. Would not recommend to my worst enemy.

Reviews.Title: “Very disappointed”
Reviews.Author: lateich
Reviews.Content: We booked 3 nights at this property and were so unhappy that we checked out after one. Our room had a pool view, which was fine but also provided a heavy chlorine smell. The bathroom was beyond disgusting - there were dozens of ants and other assorted bugs everywhere and it looked like it had not been properly cleaned in months. When we complained to the front desk and asked to switch rooms the manager refused (although the hotel was not sold out) They sent over a guy with a can of Raid, but even after spraying there were still many bugs. As Marriott Rewards members we were very disappointed with both the poor state of the room and the complete lack of customer service. There are many lovely hotels in Key West for the same price as the Courtyard, stay at one of them.

Reviews.Title: “Lucky I talked to Chuck!”
Reviews.Author: MargoGene
Reviews.Content: We were very pleased with the accommodations. Pretty site, great rooms with balconey overlooking the botanical courtyard and pool. A little far from the old part of town, but the free shuttle service was awesome. The concierge, Chuck, was so helpful and pleasant. It was purely accidental that I stopped by his desk and we started to talk, and I found out our return boat ride on the The Key West Express was cancelled due to upcoming bad weather. Chuck immediately had the phone number to call for verification and helped us plan our next course of action. We ended up renting a car and driving back to Ft. Myers and were so glad it worked out that way, as we got to see all the beautiful keys we would have missed otherwise. Chuck also recommended the Lazy Days Restaurant in Islamadora, which was fun. It was lucky he was sober and could help us out!!! :) Margo - Chaska, Mn.

Reviews.Title: “One of the best Courtyards I have stayed in.”
Reviews.Author: Ross_Toronto_Can
Reviews.Content: I am a Silver Elite member of the Marriott Rewards program, so stay at their hotels frequently. I found this place to be comfortable and relaxing. The front desk staff were extremely accomodating and made sure that I had a room the minute I checked in at 12pm, where I am rather used to waiting around till 2 or 3 for my room in other hotels. The room was comfortable and had all that I needed in amenities, it was clean and I saw no evidence of bugs that other reviewers have mentioned. The restaurant is good for a hotel breakfast is served inside, lunch is served at the Tiki bar, however they do not serve dinner there so you are pretty much guaranteed a trip to the old town every night to grab dinner. The pool is heated and quite comfortable and the hot tub is actually hot unlike other places. The pool has a Tiki bar located as part of the grounds and it is a great little hangout point for conversation with both guests, the bar staff and locals as that is a favorite watering hole for them as well. The beach out back is pleasant to lay on and sun yourself and they have lots of chairs available for that. Yes the water looks a bit like a pond but I asked about that and they had a VERY good excuse as to why. It is an aquatic nursery back there. Walking along the boardwalk back there I was able to see a baby nurse shark, juvenile barracuda as well as blue and horseshoe crabs. So if you are into or not adverse to a bit of nature around you this is deifnately a place to stay. Even around the pool you can occasionally see an iguana or the small lizards that are common in Florida. Was even able to pick some small bananas from the trees around the pool, and they were edible. The shuttle to the old town is a small shuttle bus and probably seats about 10 to 12. Never had to cram myself in when we used it as we had a rental car for our day trips and used the shuttle for the evening trips when we knew we would be out drinking. It runs every half hour so was very convenient, however it does stop running around 11pm, so if you want a late night out you will cab it home and that costs about $13. My only complaint was that they cranked up the a/c one day during my stay and I came back to a rather frigid room after a day on the beaches. But as it was still nice and warm out I opened up the sliding doors and the room was comfortable again in no time.

Reviews.Title: “Great quiet place to stay”
Reviews.Author: Jersey3
Reviews.Content: My husband and I spent Christmas here. We recieved great customer service from the reception desk. I was impressed with the complimentary timely shuttle service they offer to downtown. The room was clean. Beautiful bathrooom. Very relaxing boardwalk in rear of building to sit and relax while looking out on the water. Can't wait to return!.

Reviews.Title: “odd hotel”
Reviews.Author: earthtomark
Reviews.Content: This place was fine. It was in a part of Key WEst that i was told is called "new town" and it was where the people go to get their day to day errands done. The room was very clean, the hotel was fine, but everything was a bit off kilter, and not in a good way. We booked a king suite with a jacuzzi bath tub. And it had one as promised...just smack dab in the middle of the bedroom. Weird. The balcony was nice...it just didn't have a view of anything. The "private beach" is basically just a creek behind the hotel. In short it's a fine place, but wasn't worth the 450 taxes included I paid. Maybe more like 250.

Reviews.Title: “Nicest hotel we've stayed at in some time!”
Reviews.Author: banksville
Reviews.Content: From the street, it looked like any other hotel. From the moment we spoke with Jessica at the front desk, I knew we were somewhere special. Free ethernet in rooms, the nicest landscaping I've ever seen. The pool area and hot tub were very exotic looking. The beach was small, facing the bay, but very nice. The rooms were very comfortable and clean. The concierge was very helpful and was spot on with events in town, and where the best spots were. The staff was very friendly and helpful. It was on the other side of the island from the main business district, but the drive to town was short 5-10 minutes and, they had a free shuttle that ran all day so you enjoy yourself. I would highly recommend this hotel to anyone visiting Key West.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay but awful bed and pillows”
Reviews.Author: LosAngelesSunchaser
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 2 nights after 5 in miami beach. This isnt a very large hotel and because we stayed mid-week it appeared to be very quiet. The hotel lobby and bar were very nice and elegant with beautiful orchid arrangements all over. The room was nicely decorated. When it came to bed time, it was awful. The mattress was uncomfortable for a hotel of this caliber the pillows were of some feather composite but extremely soft. My biggest complaint was the air conditioner ducts, in my particular room they were aimed directly at our heads, this was awful causing my wife and I to return home congested from the cold air being blasted at our faces while we slept (or tried to). There is a shuttle that runs all day on the hour which drops you onto duvall, it was great no need for cabs unless of course if you decided on staying out after 11:20 pm but after being out all day on the water in the sun or whatever by 11pm we were ready to hit the rack. The pool, well it was just ok, the beach, not nice it has a view of what appears to be a landfill. The pool bar closes early which really makes it boring. On our first day there we toured the pool and it was the most depressing thing id ever seen. An older guy with a guitar singing some extremely depressing notes, im really suprized i didnt witness a suicide. It was like something out of some ben stiller comedy with couples sitting there with blank looks on their faces, it was bizzarre and not some place i wanted to hang out.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay”
Reviews.Author: reddibear
Reviews.Content: Clean Hotel We were in a room at the front of the hotel a bit to close to the road we would recomend booking a room at the rear of the hotel we did spend some time on the bord walk great sunset over key west would recommend this hotel steve from the uk

Reviews.Title: “excellent customer service!!!”
Reviews.Author: vicki1115
Reviews.Content: the moment i walked in, the guest services people (Marcelo and Barbara) greeted me with warm welcome and upgraded me to a superb room with jacuzzi!! they also have shuttle to downtown which made my life easy going to and fro - no worries about taking a cab and what not. my stay in this hotel is awesome and the staff are outstanding, very friendly specially for someone like me traveling for the first time in Key West! they treated me more like a friend than a guest specially Sharon, Jane, Ellen and Ron. You guys rock! I will surely come back to Key West and will definitely stay at the Marriott Courtyard! - Victoria (Toronto)

Reviews.Title: “Dated, not as good as other Courtyard”
Reviews.Author: funfun2
Reviews.Content: Courtyard has reputation for its cleanness. But this one is not as good as others, it's dated, Bathroom floor was leaking water and smelled horrible. The room was not as clean as other Courtyard and didn't smell good although the cleaning lady worked very hard. The staff at front desk was very nice and helpful. The hotel provides free computer access in the lobby which was good for us to check something through internet. Shuttle bus was good, ran til 11pm. Breakfast buffet wasn't that good but pricey. Blue Haven (10min driving) was the place they suggested for breakfast and it was great.

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding value!”
Reviews.Author: butterfly38
Reviews.Content: We stayed in Key West for one night and booked this hotel ahead of time. I was hesitant because it wasn't within walking distance of the things we wanted to do. This is a beautiful hotel. The front desk personnel provided incredible service and found me the perfect room with a pool view. I was notified that I had been upgraded to a suite! It was huge! We had a bedroom with 2 queen beds - extremely comfy and a separate living room - 2 large tv's, 2 full bathrooms, a large sink/bar area with fridge, coffee, etc. lots and lots of space to spread out with 2 balconies. It was more than enough for our party of 4!! The hotel conceirge desk was phenomenal at giving us maps, tips, etc. There is 24hr coffee/tea/hot chocolate in the lobby and 2 computers for use free of charge. There are only 2 drawbacks to this hotel.... #1 - breakfast is not free- in fact it is very pricey. $15 for an adult buffet and $6 for child. #2- the free shuttle service to the area near mallory square was a great service with pick-up and drop off every 1/2 hour all day... but they should consider running a second shuttle during busy times, or purchasing a larger bus (like Sheraton has) because if there are too many guests waiting, you have to race to the door to get on because there are only 11 spots. We had to wait around for the next shuttle one night late. Otherwise, it was a great hotel, very comfy, never heard any noise from any rooms and couldn't even hear any noise from the pool. Oh- the pool is very big, and very nice. Nice garden landscaping. You can also walk out and look over the waterway (no swimming) behind the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay in the Keys”
Reviews.Author: kjobgen
Reviews.Content: This was so much better than I had anticipated by the reviews. It had nice rooms, a lovely pool, and very friendly staff. This was within walking distance to Walgreens, K-mart and Albertsons. They are one of the few Hotels that offer a free shuttle every half hour. Free parking also a plus and easy to find without the hassle of going downtown.

Reviews.Title: “Deserves A Higher Rating”
Reviews.Author: SamVancouver
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a three day stay at the Courtyard Key West. We had a wonderful time and while it's not downtown KW, the shuttle more than makes up for it. There are also a couple of supermarkets within walking distance for juice and pop. Our check-in was great, with Sharon who treated me like a preferred guest. A nice room overlooking the water, a pool with a great Tiki bar, a very clean property and free internet access in the lobby. Also free parking is an added value. There's a deck/boardwalk on two sides of the property that's great for an evening relaxation. Did not try the restaurant but for breakfast, we drove to the Help Yourself organic eatery. Very funky and delicous and cheap. (on Fleming). Definitely give this hotel a try. TIP: Watch your speed on US 1 on your dive to/from the Keys. Troopers are everywhere.

Reviews.Title: “An unexpected gem!”
Reviews.Author: kkc63
Reviews.Content: We stumbled upon this hotel by accident driving around the streets of Key West in search of value for money accommodation. We had stayed one night in the nearby Radisson and were very disappointed. I stay in a lot of chain hotels with work and Marriott Courtyard would not normally be my first choice. What a find this was then! From check-in to check-out we found the staff courteous and always willing to go above and beyond. One staff member on the front desk even went to the trouble of delivering some wine glasses to our room despite the fact the hotel didn't offer room service. Breakfast was served in the dining room daily. Excellent value for money buffet or a la carte. Lunch was served at the poolside bar from 11 - 2 (we thought they could have offered lunch till 3 perhaps?). We couldn't fault the room. Clean and spacious with a comfortable bed. We were given a free upgrade to a room with a jacuzzi. The bathroom had a large wetroom style shower. The highlight had to be the pool area though. Beautifully landscaped with a variety of tropical trees for shade if you needed. The large main pool was heated. There was an outdoor spa pool which was open will 11pm. The well stocked Tikibar had a tasty bar meal menu. The staff again were charming. There was a small beach area where you could get down to the ocean. This was no where near as pleasant as the pool area, but it was nice to have the option. The hotel offered a free shuttle bus to the historic Old Town area from early morning until 1045 in the evening. The service ran on the hour and on the half our all day. Excellent service. There was no option, but to drive from the Radisson. Not what you want on holiday! I can't recommend this place enough!

Reviews.Title: “Badly managed hotel - avoid if possible”
Reviews.Author: frr123
Reviews.Content: I am a Marriott Rewards member with over 150,000 points accumulated (all used up now) during the last 10 years and although there were a few Tripadvisor negative reviews, I had to chose this hotel since I was paying with points and they were the only hotel in the Marriott family with availability (now I know why). Got to Key West at 9:00 AM on Sat May 2nd for two night's stay. We left our bag at the reception and received a claim ticket. We had a full day of activities planned so had to rush out of the hotel. I had requested a small fridge be placed on the room and extra towels. No problems they said. Got back to the hotel at about 10:00 PM tired and wanting to shower and rest. I asked for our bag and the reception person said what bag? we don't have any bags here. Well, if anyone has ever had their car stolen or house robbed, then you know how this feels. The bag had a laptop, credit card, ids, money, and personal items. It feels terrible. The lady said, well maybe we took it up to your room; go and check. Got to the room and no bag, no fridge, no extra towels and no soap. Called them and she said well I don't know where it is. hellooooooo?????? how hard is it to keep a bag stored in a luggage room? I asked if they had given my room to another person since my room didn't have a fridge as requested so they called one room close to mine to ask the people if there was an extra bag; totally unprofessional. Did they really think that someone who got an extra bag and didn't return it during the entire day was going to do it now? I was getting very upset and told them to call the people that had worked in the morning and track back what they had done to the bag. They just didn't know what to do or didn't care about solving my problem. As far as they were concerned: lost bag; that's it. Leave us alone. After about half hour we got a call that they had found the bag in the shuttle bus that goes from Marriott hotels to Marriott hotels. What? what the heck was my bag doing traveling all over KW? Not an experience I would want anyone else to have. I thought about talking to the day manager since there was no night manager on duty or to complaint to headquarters but just didn't want to let this incident continue to ruin our short vacation so just put it our of my mind and tried to enjoy KW as much as possible. But certainly, I wanted to post here so others are aware of how badly managed and unprofessional this hotel is. I must have stayed at over 15 Courtyard hotels thoroughout the U.S. and I had never experienced this level of incompetence. Do not stay there unless you don't have another choice. Also, the first night got the safe combination lock programmed with my usual code that I have used for over twenty years and opened and closed the safe a few times and in the morning when I tried to open it, guess what; invalid code. had to call and get a technician come and open it. Lastly, the rooms are not well insulated so you can hear people in the next room and people walking by the hall. So if you can hear them, I guess they can hear you. Not good if you want a private, restfull, romantic stay.

Reviews.Title: “A Highly Enjoyable Stay”
Reviews.Author: InspLimo
Reviews.Content: Booked over phone after refusing to stay in a previously booked hotel in Islamorada due to poor standadards. Marriot exceeded our expectations. Spotless Queen Suite, with 2 beds in bedroom, fold out Queen sofa in other room with large Jacuzzi bath. Reception staff friendly & efficient, public area welcoming with nice carpets and sofas, and 2 computers for guest use. Also had Wi-Fi connection (free) in that area and cable connection in room. Nice pool area with good sized heated pool, large terrace area, spa pool, and Tiki bar. Out back had decking path round waterfront area with tables and chairs for sitting out and watching views. Beach area was a little messy with debris floating in but staff cleaned it regularly, but as next to Mangrove area I would not swim in it, just soak up view. Internal corridors with secuity locks made one feel secure. Good buffet breakfatst (at extra cost) Major benefit was the free shuttle than ran hourly into Key West harbour area, and picked up from there until 10.45p.m. My first experience in a USA Marriott, and a first rate impression was gained.

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice”
Reviews.Author: dpoli
Reviews.Content: The Courtyard Waterfront is a hidden gem in Key West. The public areas are spotless and very inviting. The front desk personnel are very helpful and friendly. The rooms are very well kept and of a decent size. The pool is large and has a jacuzzi. We stayed in a first floor suite with 2 queen beds and interior corridors -- ( there are 2 buildings with exterior corridors). The living room was very large , with carpeted floors and a whirlpool tub in a croner of the living room. The large bedroom had 2 queen beds ,a chair ,night stand, and dresser. There was a kitchen area with a counter and cabinets, sink, refrig, and microwave. The bathroom was rather small and had a single sink, but it was adequate. The nice thing about the suite was that it had 2 sets of sliding glass doors that opened onto a huge furnished patio that overlooked the pool. It was very convenient for pool access and just sitting outside. We enjoyed breakfast in the cafe every morning. The buffet was reasonably priced ( $14.95) and the service and food was great. The Tiki bar by the pool offered "Happy Hour" drinks for $2-3. The Courtyard offered a complimentary shuttle into town, with pickup/dropoff at the Conch Republic. Even though we had a car, it was easier using the shuttle, as parking is a problem in Key West. The only negative that we have is the air conditioning--the units blow on you while sleeping and do not seem to extract the humidity. This gives the rooms a "moldy" odor, which does not help people with asthma.

Reviews.Title: “Was hardly there but great place to crash!!!!”
Reviews.Author: ShutUpandTravel
Reviews.Content: THere is really nothing fancy about this place. It's a Courtyard!!! Anyway, my room was clean and the breakfast the next morning was great. We took the tram from the hotel that drops you off right at the top of Duval. The only thing I would change is to keep the tram going longer. We took a cab back from Sloppy Joe's and it cost like 10 Bucks. I did walk by the pool and the jacuzzi but didn't use it. I had too many other things to do while in Key West!!! I gave it a three because it's a Courtyard. i think excellent is a good B&B. No complaints other than the tram. Contact with any questions.

HotelInfo.Name: Courtyard Key West Waterfront
HotelInfo.Address: 3031-41 North Roosevelt Boulevard, Key West, FL 33040
